curriculum_stages.name: Basic Hit or Stand
curriculum_stages.description: Learn the fundamental decision of whether to hit or stand based on the player's hand and the dealer's upcard. This stage focuses on understanding the basic rules and probabilities of Blackjack. The agent should learn to avoid busting and to stand when the hand is likely to beat the dealer's.

curriculum_stages.name: Adding Double Down
curriculum_stages.description: Introduce the 'Double Down' action. The agent should learn when doubling down is advantageous based on the player's hand (e.g., hard 11, hard 10 against a low dealer upcard) and dealer's upcard. This requires a more nuanced understanding of expected value.

curriculum_stages.name: Introducing Early Surrender
curriculum_stages.description: Introduce 'Early Surrender'. The agent must learn to identify situations where surrendering is the optimal choice, generally when the player has a very weak hand against a strong dealer upcard (e.g., 16 vs. 9, 10, or Ace). This improves risk management and loss mitigation.

curriculum_stages.name: Mastering Splitting Pairs
curriculum_stages.description: Introduce 'Splitting Pairs'. The agent must learn which pairs to split (e.g., Aces, 8s) and which not to split (e.g., 10s, 5s) depending on the dealer's upcard. This stage requires considering the long-term expected value of splitting versus playing the hand as is.

curriculum_stages.name: Full Blackjack Strategy with Insurance
curriculum_stages.description: The final stage incorporates 'Insurance'. The agent will now use all available actions. It should learn when taking insurance is strategically beneficial (although generally discouraged in basic strategy, the agent may learn specific situations where it is advantageous based on card counting or game variations, assuming that this info can be learned without directly giving the agent access to the true card counts). This stage represents a complete Blackjack game environment where the agent can apply and refine all learned strategies.
